pageContext.claim: “We're going after [the governorship in] Virginia. They want to take your Second Amendment away.”
pageContext.analysis: Whether the gun-control laws under debate in Virginia attack the Second Amendment is a matter of opinion, but laws that passed the Virginia Senate on Jan. 17 would not take away guns from Virginia residents. The three bills include requiring background checks on all firearm sales, limiting gun purchases to one in a 30-day period, and allowing localities to ban guns from public events.
